newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentine province in Northern Orion deal.
newsitem.headline: Argentine province in Northern Orion deal.

text.p: Argentina's Catamarca province has agreed details of a contract to be signed in days with Canada's Northern Orion to explore its Antofalla Este gold prospect, a provincial official said Tuesday.

"The provincial decree authorizing the contract was issued two months ago and we are just waiting for the final bureaucratic formalities to be completed before signing," the northwestern province's Mining Secretary Raul Galarza told Reuters in an interview.
"Northern Orion, through Grupo Minero Aconcagua, could start drilling this month," Galarza said.

The 8,200-hectare site in the area of Antofagasta de la Sierra is at over 4,000 meters above sea-level but its dry climate should mean that snow should not impede work there in the coming southern hemisphere winter.
The prospect has vein formations including lead, silver and zinc, together with mineralization associated with disseminated gold. The gold provides the main economic interest, Galarza said.
Catamarca is also negotiating exploration contracts with Northern Orion for its La Hoyada and Diablillos prospects, and with Australia's BHP Ltd for the Filo Colorado area.
"The talks are going slower than we would like," Galarza said, "But we want to have handed over all our prospects to the private sector by the end of 1997."
Catamarca is the site of the $1-billion Bajo de la Alumbrera copper and gold project being developed by MIM Holdings and North Ltd together with Canada's Rio Algom

BHP is developing the nearby Agua Rica copper project, which is already being spoken about in the industry as being a potential rival to Bajo de la Alumbrera in size. BHP has 70 percent of Agua Rica and Northern Orion has 30 percent.
